Test: Reticular Action Model

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2020-07-16

Source: vignettes/tests/test_ram.Rmd
test_ram.Rmd

Set test parameters

\[\begin{equation} Y_i = \delta_Y + \tau^{\prime} X_i + \beta M_i + \varepsilon_{Y_{i}} \end{equation}\]

\[\begin{equation} M_i = \delta_M + \alpha X_i + \varepsilon_{M_{i}} \end{equation}\]

The Simple Mediation Model

Parameters
Variable Description Value
tau_prime Path from \(X\) to \(Y\) (\(\tau^{\prime}\)). 0.3443410
beta Path from \(M\) to \(Y\) (\(\beta\)). 0.4767892
alpha Path from \(X\) to \(M\) (\(\alpha\)). 0.3102264
sigma2X Variance of \(X\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{X}\)) 151.7356943
sigma2epsilonM Residual variance of \(\epsilon_{M}\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{\varepsilon_{M}}\)) 95.1467007
sigma2epsilonY Residual variance of \(\epsilon_{Y}\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{\varepsilon_{Y}}\)) 147.1876821
muX Mean of \(X\) (\(\mu_X\)) 32.6949818
delta_M Intercept for model predicting \(M\) (\(\delta_M\)) 21.6605854
delta_Y Intercept for model predicting \(Y\) (\(\delta_Y\)) 14.7316620
A Matrix
X M Y
X 0.0000000 0.0000000 0
M 0.3102264 0.0000000 0
Y 0.3443410 0.4767892 0
S Matrix
X M Y
X 151.7357 0.0000 0.0000
M 0.0000 95.1467 0.0000
Y 0.0000 0.0000 147.1877
F Matrix
X M Y
X 1 0 0
M 0 1 0
Y 0 0 1
I Matrix
X M Y
X 1 0 0
M 0 1 0
Y 0 0 1

Model-Implied Matrices

Sigmatheta <- ram_Sigmatheta(
  A = A,
  S = S,
  F = F,
  I = I
)
Sigmatheta2 <- ram_S(
  A = A,
  sigma2 = sigma2,
  F = F,
  I = I,
  SigmaMatrix = TRUE
)
S_ver2 <- ram_S(
  A = A,
  sigma2 = sigma2,
  F = F,
  I = I,
  SigmaMatrix = FALSE
)
M <- ram_M(
  A = A,
  F = F,
  I = I,
  mu = mu
)
mutheta <- ram_mutheta(
  A = A,
  F = F,
  I = I,
  M = M
)
M <- as.vector(M)
names(M) <- var_names

Generate Data with \(\hat{\boldsymbol{\Sigma}}\) equal to \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) 

data <- mvrnorm(
  n = 1000,
  mu = mu,
  Sigma = Sigmatheta,
  empirical = TRUE
)

Estimate Parameters from Data

model <- "
  Y ~ tau_prime*X + beta*M
  M ~ alpha*X
  X ~~ sigma2X*X
  M ~~ sigma2epsilonM*M
  Y ~~ sigma2epsilonY*Y
  X ~ muX*1
  M ~ delta_M*1
  Y ~ delta_Y*1
"
fit <- sem(
  model = model,
  data = data,
  likelihood = "wishart"
)
thetahat <- as.vector(coef(fit))
muhat <- as.vector(colMeans(data))

Results

Model-implied variance-covariance matrix
X M Y
X 151.73569 47.07242 74.69244
M 47.07242 109.74981 68.53648
Y 74.69244 68.53648 205.58481
Model-implied mean vector
\(\boldsymbol{\mu}\)
X 32.69498
M 31.80343
Y 41.15342

Path from \(X\) to \(Y\) (\(\tau^{\prime}\)). 0.3443410 0.3443410
Path from \(M\) to \(Y\) (\(\beta\)). 0.4767892 0.4767892
Path from \(X\) to \(M\) (\(\alpha\)). 0.3102264 0.3102264
Variance of \(X\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{X}\)) 151.7356943 151.7356936
Residual variance of \(\epsilon_{M}\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{\varepsilon_{M}}\)) 95.1467007 95.1467005
Residual variance of \(\epsilon_{Y}\) (\(\sigma^{2}_{\varepsilon_{Y}}\)) 147.1876821 147.1876804
Mean of \(X\) (\(\mu_X\)) 32.6949818 32.6949818
Intercept for model predicting \(M\) (\(\delta_M\)) 21.6605854 21.6605853
Intercept for model predicting \(Y\) (\(\delta_Y\)) 14.7316620 14.7316621
Mean of \(X\) (\(\mu_X\)) 32.6949818 32.6949818
Mean of \(M\) (\(\mu_M\)) 31.8034317 31.8034317
Mean of \(Y\) (\(\mu_Y\)) 41.1534173 41.1534173

testthat

test_that("theta and thetahat are equivalent", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = theta,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = thetahat,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("mu, mutheta, and muhat are equivalent", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = mu,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = mutheta,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = muhat,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("ram_M returns the correct values", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = theta[7:9],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = thetahat[7:9],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = M,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("muX", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = muX,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = M[1],
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("muM", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = muM,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = M[2] + alpha * muX,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("muY", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = muY,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = M[3] + tau_prime * muX + beta * muM,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("S", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = S,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = S_ver2,
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
test_that("Sigma", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = Sigmatheta,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = Sigmatheta2,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = cov(data),
      digits = 2
    )
  )
})
